ARABIC: وَهُزِّىٓ إِلَيْكِ بِجِذْعِ ٱلنَّخْلَةِ تُسَٰقِطْ عَلَيْكِ رُطَبًا جَنِيًّا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Shake the trunk of the palm towards you and fresh, ripe dates will drop down onto you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Shake the trunk of the date-palm tree, and it will drop ripe dates for you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards yourself and fresh and ripe dates shall fall upon you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: If you shake the trunk of the palm tree, it will provide you with fresh ripe dates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you – ripe fresh dates will fall upon you.” (This was a miracle – the date palm was dry and it was winter season.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And shake the trunk of date palm towards you, it will let fall fresh ripe dates upon you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And shake towards you the trunk of the palmtree, it will drop on you fresh ripe dates:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Shake also to thee the palm-trunk, and there shall come tumbling upon thee dates fresh and ripe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree toward thee, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and if you shake the trunk of this palm-tree, it will drop fresh ripe dates on you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And shake toward thee the trunk of the palm-tree it shall drop on thee dates fresh and ripe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Shake the trunk of the palm tree, freshly picked dates will drop upon you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And shake towards thyself the trunk of the palm-tree: It will let fall fresh ripe dates upon thee.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And shake the trunk of date-palm towards you, it will let fall fresh ripe-dates upon you."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and shake the trunk of this palmtree it will drop fresh ripe dates upon you.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, and it will drop ripe dates by you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [19:25] And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, [a palm-tree] which had withered (the bi- [in bi-jidh‘i’lnakhlati, ‘the trunk of the palm-tree] is extra) — there will drop (tusāqit, originally this is tatasāqat, but the second tā’ is changed into a sīn and is assimilated with the [second] sīn; a variant reading omits it [the second tā’] altogether) on you dates (rutaban, a specification) fresh and ripe (janiyyan, an adjectival qualification of it [of rutaban, ‘dates’]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And shake the trunk of the palm-tree towards you, thou wilt cause ripe dates to fall upon thee).
